snippet: The string of revelations over the past 48 hours about sweeping government surveillance stirred expressions of concern across the country on Friday — along with something of a collective national shrug.
abstract: String of revelations about sweeping government surveillance of American telephone records and Internet activity by foreigners have stirred expressions of concern across the country, along with something of a collective national shrug.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jess Bidgood from Cambridge, Mass.; Robbie Brown from Atlanta; Dan Frosch from Denver; Emily Gogolak, Mona El-Naggar and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York; Ian Lovett from Los Angeles; Kim Severson from Mount Airy, N.C.; and Steven Yaccino from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: The string of revelations over the past 48 hours about sweeping government surveillance stirred expressions of concern across the country on Friday — along with something of a collective national shrug.

headline.main: In U.S., News of Surveillance Effort Is Met With Some Concern but Little Surprise
headline.print_headline: In U.S., News of Surveillance Effort Is Met With Some Concern but Little Surprise
